definitions.definition: To give property to (someone) as a gift ; specifically, to provide (a person or institution ) with support in the form of a permanent fund of money or other benefits .
To enrich or furnish with some faculty or quality .
definitions.label_groups: transitive , followed by with , or rarely by of

examples: She was endowed with a beautiful voice.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , usually in the passive voice

definitions.definition: To provide with a dower ( “ the portion that a widow receives from her deceased husband 's property ” ) or a dowry ( “ property given to a bride ” ) .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To give property to (someone) as a gift ; specifically, to provide (a person or institution ) with support in the form of a permanent fund of money or other benefits .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , followed by with , or rarely by of ) To enrich or furnish with some faculty or quality .
( transitive , usually in the passive voice ) To naturally furnish (with something).
( transitive , archaic or obsolete ) To provide with a dower ( “ the portion that a widow receives from her deceased husband 's property ” ) or a dowry ( “ property given to a bride ” ) .
